info.headline: High Surf Advisory issued February 12 at 3:26AM HST until February 13 at 6:00AM HST by NWS Honolulu
info.description: ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY FOR EAST FACING SHORES OF KAUAI OAHU MOLOKAI MAUI BIG ISLAND AND KAHOOLAWE THROUGH 6 AM MONDAY... .Large and very rough trade wind swell will continue through tonight, with advisory level surf affecting east facing shores of most islands. Surf could remain elevated at or above the advisory threshold along some east facing shores through much of the upcoming work week. ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM HST MONDAY... * WHAT...Surf 8 to 12 feet. * WHERE...East facing shores of Kauai, Oahu, Molokai, Maui, the Big Island and Kahoolawe. * WHEN...Until 6 AM HST Monday. * IMPACTS...Moderate. Strong breaking waves and strong currents will make swimming dangerous.
info.instruction: Head all advice from ocean safety officials. When in doubt, don`t go out.
